headline: Foods Fit for a Revolution
abstract: How the Hong Kong democracy movement feeds on the city’s distinct identity.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — “Who says I can’t sell an ice cream cone and add a gas mask on the side?” Chung Yiu-wa, the co-owner of Sogno Gelato, said. “I have a license to sell, and I can attach free gifts if I want. I’m not breaking any laws.”
